  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34369].

Often when drafting up a page I will start with a list of items, and then realise that I need extra information for each point, such as assignee, notes, relevant material etc. The conversion process is currently manual and tedious. It would be great to be able to either:
* Copy paste a list into a table and have it divide into rows, or
* Have a tool that you pass a list into which outputs a table

Bonus points for dividing into columns based on common delimiters!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34338].
  {panel}

Instructional text in a global page template marked with user mention feature does not work with various browsers (Chrome 36, Firefox 31, IE 11 all on Windows 7. Works as a charm with Safari on OSX).

How to repeat:
1. Create a template
2. Create an instructional text like "Type @ to add a user mention"
3. Mark instructional text as "User mention"
4. Save template an create a new page using the template
5. Click on the instructional text and type @

Result: The user mention dialog opens but will never find a result as the complete instructional text is used as search string for a user name. The cursor is set AFTER the instructional text. On IE 11 the mention works BUT the user name is displayed at the top of the page no matter where the instructional text is positioned on the page.

This is also true for typing [ when searching for a page on a "standard" instructional text.

This makes it impossible for us to use instructional text for user guidance.
fields.summary: User Mention feature of Instructional Text Macro does not work with various browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34326].
  {panel}

I have recently started migrating our content from using the [Metadata plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.andya.confluence.plugins.metadata] to the Page Properties macro. I am doing this because the Metadata plugin seems to be no longer fully supported and does not have rich text support.

We collect the data from page properties macros into a single page using the page properties report in the same way we used to with the Metadata-list and Metadata-report macros. We edit the page and replace the existing metadata-list macro with the Page Properties macro.

This has resulted in extremely slow load speeds for the pages using the page properties report macro.

|| Page  ||  Load speed ||
| Page with "Page Properties Report" macro | ~38 seconds |
| Page without "Page Properties Report" macro | ~1 second |

For the example above: There are 780 pages in the space. No restricted pages in the space. I am asking the report to show only properties of pages with a single label.

I suspect there is a conflict between the Metadata plugin and the Page Prroperties macro.
fields.summary: Slow load speed for page using Page Properties Macro report

Any existing code macros display the code on pages but without any syntax highlighting. When you edit the macro itself (or insert a new one) there's an error above the code preview "Error rendering macro 'code': Invalid value specified for parameter 'lang'", and the Syntax Highlighting dropdown says "java" and nothing else. Enabling and disabling the plugin hasn't done anything, nor has a restart. No obvious errors are logged when disabling/enabling the plugin too.

{noformat}
Error rendering macro 'code': Invalid value specified for parameter 'lang'
{noformat}


I haven't been able to reproduce this in a test environment, but we've got 3 support cases so far.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34315].
  {panel}

Below is the suggested improvement from one of our customer:

It would be great if there is support for Oracle JCE in addition to Bouncy Castle to be able to make use of AES Intrinsics and thus speed up trusted app handshakes.

In confluence with a page with many JIRA issues, I see significant delays and CPU consumption by DefaultTrustedApplication.verifySignature - spend in Bouncy Castle math.

From research I assume that this could be sped up by factor of 2-3 when using the AESIntrinsics available Oracle JVM's (1.7 recent).
See -XX:+UseAES -XX:+UseAESIntrinsics

However I think this requires the use of Oracle JCE, not Bouncy Castle.
fields.summary: Support for Sun JCE in addition to Bouncy Castle to be able to make use of AES Intrinsics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34304].
  {panel}

Steps:
- Open confluence editor 
- Add an image has size (2000x2000) in the insert image dialog
- insert it into page
- *NOW*, if you click on the properties, you will be able to add effect for the image
- Save the page, edit again, click on the properties you will see message ( "the file sizes is too big to apply effect")

Issues:
- Issue #1: It behave differently with the new insert case and after you save the page and modify image
- Issue #2: In my opinion, we should allow user to apply effect for "an instance" of the image that user already reduce the size. The reason is, when you apply the effect, you only apply it for "an instance". I tested by insert 2 instances of the SAME SMALL image in page and apply 2 different effects for them, and it's OK. So, if that instance is small enough to apply effect, then allow them to do so.
fields.summary: Images effects should be able to be applied if user reduce the size of the image

Currently, we are working to upgrade our Confluence platform to the latest version. We also would like to make it support external CAS for authentication that requires us to change all existing login usernames to another format.

The current usernames are in short names and we look to find a way to do bulk right-padding with a common string '@something.com' for all usernames.

It seems recently there's been a trend of data placed in confluence_home/indexes/ that cannot be regenerated. This includes:

* /edge index (to show popular pages in the popular tab)
* /questions-edge index (to show which questions in Questions are popular)

Can we please have these located elsewhere? It's very difficult to know if new plugins installed are utilizing that folder. We normally exclude everying within the /indexes directory.

It's been standard recommendation in the docs that [indexes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Home+and+other+important+directories] can be safely rebuilt which is no longer true.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34288].
  {panel}

When using an evaluation license during installation of Confluence OnDemand 5.5-OD-28-010 or in the BTF version of Confluence 5.6.1 Download version, it bypasses the database type setup screen and only uses HSQLDB, skipping directly to the User Management screen.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Download and install [Confluence 5.5-OD-28-010|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-od] or Confluence 5.6.1
# Under Production Installation click Start Setup button
# Paste in a Confluence evaluation license and hit next

h3. Expected behavior
User would be presented with the Choose a Database Configuration screen, and be able to setup whatever DB they want.

h3. Actual behavior
Confluence setup immediately selects HSQLDB and the user is eventually presented with the Configure User Management screen, completely bypassing Choose a Database Configuration screen.

h3. Workaround
* Use a non-evaluation license (ex. commercial license, developer license, etc) while installing 5.6.1
* If you are evaluating Confluence and must use an evaluation license, install Confluence 5.5.6 with an evaluation license (this will allow you to choose an external database), then upgrade to 5.6.1
fields.summary: Confluence defaults to HSQLDB when using evaluation license

fields.summary: Could Not Export Pages to PDF When Containing Space-related Macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34265].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
When using the _noformat_ macro, having its placeholder expanded beyond uper and lower limits of the Confluence editor boundaries, the popup with "_Edit|Remove_" is displayed over the corner bottom left.

That can lead to a user accidentally hitting _Remove_ and losing the data on screen.

!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Desired Fix
Place the popup somewhere else on the screen in a sense that it does not get in place of the cursor.
fields.summary: Macro popup appears over cursor at bottom of screen
another request to "Bring back option to show full text in notification emails"
Confluence Cloud only includes English (UK) and not English (US) language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34257].
  {panel}

Following keys are missing in production TAC:
* com.atlassian.mywork.providers.confluence.blog.comment.title
* com.atlassian.mywork.providers.confluence.page.comment.title

Please check if they exist in Confluence and why they are not imported correctly.

Comes from: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29442

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34217].
  {panel}

By default, when a new user is created, it will be automatically added into {{confluence-users}} group.

When you want to assign the user to a another group, you will have to redirect into the "Groups" tab and and add membership to the user.

There may be some cases when Confluence Administrators removed {{confluence-users}} group and define its own "can-use" group members. When adding new user, the bug occurs where adding user permission is denied - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22778

It will be an additional feature and bonus in convenience for Confluence if Confluence Administrators would be able to define the group membership from the beginning so that the issue above can be prevented.
fields.summary: Apply Group Selection when Adding User in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34213].
  {panel}

To reproduce, create a space "TestBug" in Confluence, then do the following on the space permissions:
# Strip out all Anonymous access from TestBug
# Remove the jira-administrators group from group permissions (note we are using integrated access from JIRA)
# Add in admin-user1 to the individual users section
# Login as admin-user2
# Confirm that admin-user2 is unable to see TestBug space in list of spaces
# Go to Confluence Admin -> Space Permissions
# Press the "Recover Permissions" button for TestBug
# It should change to "Manage Permissions"; try to click that link
# You should get to an error page saying Not Permitted

Now, back as admin-user1, you can validate that admin-user2 got added to the individual users section as an Admin, but has no View access, so cannot see the admin page.

This is bad news if you dont have a fellow admin to help you unlock yourself or regain access.
fields.summary: Recover Permissions - does not work on a site if jira-administrators group not set

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34211]. {panel} Due to some attachment changes made for 2.2, images on a page exported to Word (in a private space) do not show up. This is because Confluence will now require "Word" to login to view those attachments (when a previous security hole allowed it) accessed through the direct URL, and so the image does not appear. e.g. the following IMG tag embedded in the exported Word (HTML) document links directly to an attachment. Attempting to access this (with the domain pre-pended) will result in the login screen appearing. *Workarounds:* Office Connector (for 3.5.x and previous versions only) The [Office Connector for Confluence|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221] does not have this problem. Instead of selecting Tools > Export to Word, you select Tools > Edit in Word . This will open up the Confluence page in Word, including any images. You can then do whatever you like with the file on your local machine and save changes back to the server if needed. -2. Set A Cookie- -Simply login to Confluence using Internet Explorer and tick "Remember my login on this computer". So long as this cookie is maintained by Internet Explorer (i.e. until you wipe your cookies or click log out), you will be able to successfully view all images when viewing your document in Word. Note that this will be remain effective after you close IE although it will need to be performed after a restart of the server.- *Edit:* Set A Cookie work around does not work. Please use Office Connector instead.
fields.summary: Images in Word export pages do not show up because of login requirement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34202].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence display it's URL in full ASCII format. When special character is included in the URL, sometimes, this character is not properly recognize in the URL when send in the mail. 

For example
 # Create a new page
# Add a heading in the page "test?"
 # Add there the toc macro.
# Copy that URL, and send it through email to someone else.
# That person clicks on the URL, the wiki page opens, but does not direct to the correct heading.  You will notice the '?' character is not considered as a part of the URL:
!sample.png!

However this could be mitigated if the URL is encoded in the following format.  {{<confluence-URL>/display/VM/TEST#TEST%3F}}


This can be rather inconvience for user who wish to send Confluence URL in a mail.
fields.summary: Encoding ASCII Special Character in URL encoding.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34182].
  {panel}

We already can do a lot with keyboard in the Confluence editor. However, one thing that always bugs me is that I need to use the mouse to bring up the macro editor for a selected macro.

Proposal:
ALT+SPACE Could bring up the list of actions for a given macro (normally Edit/Remove). Then I need to be able to move in this list using TAB/SHIFT+TAB. A Following ENTER would execute the action. This behavior would be especially useful for macros defining their own action (status, team calendar etc.)

ALT+ENTER would instantly do the default action. In almost all cases this is bringing up the macro editor.

In normal cases this behavior would be enabled when the macro is 'text'-selected. One option to think about would be to also extend this behavior to the macro directly following the text cursor. Would remove the need to first SHIFT+ARROW the macro.

Please have a heart for our keyboard loving users and make it happen. thx!
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open the macro editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34177].
  {panel}

Importing a space export, sometimes causes the creator and last modifier of a page to be displayed as anonymous, despite the data seems correct in the {{entities.xml}}. This does not happens for all pages or versions, only some of them.

h3. Workaround for Server solution
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Space+or+Site+XML+imported+Page+or+Blog+Creator+is+shown+as+Anonymous

h3. Workaround for Cloud solution
In Cloud, this might be due to the username being different (export vs import). 

a) Update the username of the user having Anonymous to be the same as the username in the previous account
b) Delete the imported space
c) Try importing again
